title: The Queen, the chef, and the president
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Prince Edward Island - Social life and customs
People/Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain, 1926-
History/Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain, 1926-
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Visits of state
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Village communities
description: During Prince Edward Island's centennial celebrations one of the places visited by Queen Elizabeth II was the tiny pioneer Acadian village of Mount Carmel, restored as part of a winter works project. This film records many amusing sidelights before and during the visit, as villagers did what they could to make sure that everything - lunch in a newly built restaurant, entertainment on an outdoor platform - went smoothly.
